title: Fed’s Bullard Explains His Dissent on Rate Cut He Calls Too Small
text:
James Bullard, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis, said the U.S. central bank this week should have lowered rates by more than it did to further ensure the economy can navigate a climate of rising risk.

“Lowering the target range for the federal funds rate by 50 basis points at this time would provide insurance against further declines in expected inflation and a slowing economy subject to elevated downside risks,” Mr. Bullard said in a Friday statement explaining his dissenting vote at this week’s Federal...
description: St. Louis Fed leader James Bullard said the central bank should have lowered rates by more than it did to further ensure the economy can navigate a climate of rising risk.
